alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore; Southern Lake, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 28 at 2:28PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Minnesota and Wisconsin, including the following counties, in northeast Minnesota, Cook and Lake. In Wisconsin, Ashland, Bayfield, Douglas, Iron, Price, Sawyer and Washburn Counties. * WHEN...Through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A band of moderate rain will continue to fall over northwest Wisconsin into Friday night. An additional 0.3 to 0.6 inches of rain is expected tonight into early Saturday morning over this area. Lighter rain, but falling over a still deep snowpack in the Minnesota Arrowhead, could lead to elevated flows in waterways in the Arrowhead and North Shore as well through this weekend. Rain switches over to a wintry mix of rain and snow in these areas by Saturday and lasts into Sunday, but could still lead to some runoff into waterways within the Watch area. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore; Southern Lake, North Shore
